CompanySettings.title: CompanySettings
CompanySettings.description: Stores company-specific settings for the bookkeeping application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the company settings.

kenitala.description: Icelandic identification number (Kenitala) of the company.

nextInvoiceNumber.description: The next invoice number to be used.

Entry.title: Entry
Entry.description: Represents a financial entry, either a sale or an expense.

category.description: Category of the entry (e.g., Sales, Rent, Supplies).

type.description: The entry type, either a sale or an expense.

paymentMethod.description: The method of payment for the entry.

Invoice.title: Invoice
Invoice.description: Represents an invoice generated by the application.

AppUser.title: AppUser
AppUser.description: Represents a user of the application.

kennitala.description: Icelandic identification number (Kennitala) of the user.

accessAllowed.description: Flag to determine if the user's access is allowed.

roles.description: A list of roles assigned to the user for access control.

plan.description: The subscription plan of the user.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the user was created.

ActivityLog.title: ActivityLog
ActivityLog.description: Represents a single recorded user action for auditing purposes.

id.description: Unique identifier for the log entry.

userId.description: The ID of the user who performed the action.

userEmail.description: The email of the user who performed the action.

action.description: A description of the action performed (e.g., 'user_signup', 'update_invoice').

timestamp.description: The date and time when the action occurred.

details.description: An object containing additional details about the event.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to support a multi-tenant bookkeeping application where each user's data is isolated within their own document tree. A new top-level `activityLogs` collection is added to store audit trails securely. Access to this collection is restricted by security rules to prevent tampering.
